title.hi: Our Lady with the Infant Jesus Riding on a Lamb with St. John

objinfo.medium: water-based tempera with a glue and/or gum binder and with pen and ink outlining

provenance.name: Victoria and Albert Museum
provenance.note: Acquired, and probably commissioned, from Blake by Thomas Butts, c. 1800; by inheritance in 1845 to Thomas Butts, Jr.; sold from his collection, Foster and Son auction, London, 29 June 1853, lot 79 (11s. to Sir William Stirling-Maxwell); Gen. Archibald Stirling, probably by inheritance in 1878; Lt.-Col. William Stirling, probably by inheritance in 1931; sold 1953 to the Victoria and Albert Museum.

desc.objtitle: Our Lady with the Infant Jesus Riding on a Lamb with St. John, Object 1 (Butlin 409)

objnote.p: Blake signed the work with his monogram and dated it on the tree trunk lower right; see the textual transcription. The painting was restored by John Hell in 1953-54.

illustration.illusobjdesc: The scene unfolds within an extensive landscape of cloudy sky, mountains, hills, a river, grass, leafy trees, plants, and flowers. The child Jesus rides a sheep, which a young John the Baptist feeds, while Mary steadies Jesus. Jesus's hair is short curly. His body is twisted so that the lower half faces left while the upper half faces forward. He has his right arm raised horizontally and points left with his right hand. Jesus's left arm is raised at 135 degrees, holding onto Mary's arm. He sits on the sheep with legs spread. The sheep, apparently walking with the right front leg raised, faces left with its mouth open. It may be about to eat the long grass or grain that John the Baptist holds in his left hand. Mary stands to the right of Jesus, holding him steady on the sheep. She has long, curly hair, partly pulled up in a bun. Mary wears a gown and bends forward, facing left and down to look at Jesus. To the sheep's left stands John the Baptist, facing forward in a contrapposto stance. His left leg is extended behind him and is on tiptoe. John the Baptist is nude, genitals evident, and has short, curly hair. He holds grass or grain stems with tassels in his left hand and the intertwined branches of a plant or vine, with leaves or blossoms at its top, in his lowered right hand. No such scene is described in the Bible, but the subject is traditional.

component.illusobjdesc: In the center of the design is a young, nude Jesus with short, curly hair. His body is twisted so that the lower half faces left while the upper half faces forward. He has his right arm raised horizontally and he points to the left with his right hand, index finger extended. Jesus's left arm is raised at 135 degrees, holding onto Mary's arm. His legs are spread as he sits astride and rides a sheep.

The sheep that Jesus sits on faces left, with its mouth open. It may be about to eat the long grass or grain that John the Baptist holds in his left hand. The sheep's right front leg is raised slightly, as though it is walking.
Mary stands to the right of Jesus, holding him steady on the sheep. She has long, curly hair, partly pulled up in a bun. Mary wears a gown and bends forward, facing left and down to look at Jesus.

To the left of the sheep stands John the Baptist, facing forward in a contrapposto stance. His left leg is extended behind him and is on tiptoe. John the Baptist is nude, with genitals pictured, and has short, curly hair. His right arm is at his side and he holds in his lowered right hand the intertwined stems of a vine or plant, possibly with flowers at its top. His left arm is bent slightly upward and extended toward the sheep, apparently to feed him the long grass or grain tassels on stems that the boy holds in his left hand. He may be smiling.

On the left and right sides of the design stand trees with leafy branches that arch over the scene and intertwine top center. Grass and other indeterminate vegetation, including more leafy trees, fill out the landscape in the middle distance.
A river or stream with small waves runs behind he figures and meanders into the distance.
Hills and mountains rise on the horizon.
A vine with leaves, possibly ivy, winds around the tree on the right. Leafy plants grow left of the base of the tree. The plants closest to the tree and furthest from it may bear flowers.

leafy plants grow right and left of the base of the tree on the left. The plant just right of the tree may bear flowers. The stalk of a plant winds up the right side of the tree; it bears lily-like blooms. Touches of red suggest flowers on the plant on the left side of the tree trunk.
The ground appears to be covered with grass.
